description:
Streptomyces curacoi is a species of actinobacteria that belongs to the genus Streptomyces. Actinobacteria are a phylum of Gram-positive, high G+C content bacteria that are known for their ability to produce a wide range of secondary metabolites, including many medically and industrially important compounds.

Streptomyces curacoi was first isolated from soil samples collected in Cura√ßao, a Caribbean island. It is a filamentous, aerobic bacterium that forms branching hyphae and spores. The species is characterized by its ability to produce a range of bioactive secondary metabolites, including antibiotics and antifungal compounds.

Streptomyces curacoi is of interest to researchers and industry due to its potential for the production of novel natural products with therapeutic or biotechnological applications. The species has been the subject of various studies aimed at understanding its genetic and metabolic potential, as well as exploring its use in the development of new antimicrobial and other pharmaceutical agents.
